column1: The employee's mental health state transitioned from feeling frustrated and overwhelmed due to physical limitations in late July (score of 4) to experiencing increased isolation and stress in early August (score of 3). As the months progressed
column3: they began incorporating strategies that improved their well-being
column4: leading to scores in the mid-range (5 to 7) until December. By late December
column5: the employee noted a significant improvement in mental and emotional health
column6: ending the year feeling optimistic and ready for new challenges. Their special beliefs also showed a positive evolution
column7: starting with feelings of inadequacy and comparison stress
column8: but shifting towards a stronger emphasis on resilience
column10: and collaborative success by the year's end.
